member.name: T:Rampastring.Tools.Conversions
member.summary: Provides static methods for converting data types.

member.name: M:Rampastring.Tools.Conversions.BooleanFromString(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts a string to a boolean.
member.param: The string to convert.
The default value to return if the conversion fails.
member.returns: A boolean based on the given string.

member.summary: Converts a boolean to a string with the specified style.

member.returns: A string that represents the boolean with the specified style.

member.summary: Converts a string with the English number format to a float.

member.returns: A float based on the given string.

member.summary: Converts a string with the English number format to a double.

The default value to return if the conversion fails.
member.returns: A double based on the given string.

member.summary: Converts a string with the English number format to an integer.

member.returns: An integer based on the given string.

member.name: M:Rampastring.Tools.Conversions.BoolArrayIntoBytes(System.Boolean[])
member.summary: Converts an array of booleans into an array of bytes, packing 8 boolean values into a single byte.
member.param: The boolean array.
member.returns: The generated array of bytes.

member.name: M:Rampastring.Tools.Conversions.ByteToBoolArray(System.Byte)
member.summary: Converts a byte to an array of 8 booleans.

member.returns: An array of 8 booleans.

The value of the INI key.

member.summary: Removes a key from the INI section. Does not throw an exception if the key does not exist.
member.param: The name of the INI key to remove.

member.name: M:Rampastring.Tools.IIniSection.GetBooleanValue(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a boolean value from the INI section.
member.param: The name of the INI key.
The value to return if the section or key wasn't found, or converting the key's value to a boolean failed.
member.returns: The given key's value if the section and key was found and the value is a valid boolean. Otherwise the given defaultValue.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the parser should only parse pre-determined (via ) sections or all sections in the INI file.

member.name: P:Rampastring.Tools.IniFile.Comment
member.summary: Comment line to write to the INI file when it's written.

member.name: M:Rampastring.Tools.IniFile.ConsolidateIniFiles(Rampastring.Tools.IniFile,Rampastring.Tools.IniFile)
member.summary: Consolidates two INI files, adding all of the second INI file's contents to the first INI file. In case conflicting keys are found, the second INI file takes priority.
member.param: The first INI file.
The second INI file.

member.summary: Adds a section into the INI file.

member.name: M:Rampastring.Tools.IniFile.CombineSections(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Combines two INI sections, with the second section overriding in case conflicting keys are present. The combined section then over-writes the second section.
member.param: The name of the first INI section.
The name of the second INI section.

member.summary: Erases all existing keys of a section. Does nothing if the section does not exist.
member.param: The name of the section.

member.name: T:Rampastring.Tools.Logger
member.summary: A fairly self-explanatory class for logging.

member.name: T:Rampastring.Tools.SafePath
member.summary: Provides safe cross platform Path handling.

member.name: M:Rampastring.Tools.SafePath.CombineDirectoryPath(System.String[])
member.summary: Safely combines multiple directory paths for all platforms. The first path can be a relative or absolute path.
member.param: Ordered list of directory paths.
member.returns: The combined directory path of all , with trailing separator character and with leading separator character if the path has a root.

member.name: M:Rampastring.Tools.SafePath.CombineFilePath(System.String[])
member.summary: Safely combines multiple directory paths with a file name for all platforms. The first path can be a relative or absolute path.
member.param: Ordered list of directory paths with a file name.
member.returns: The combined directory path and file name of all with leading separator character if the path has a root.

member.name: M:Rampastring.Tools.SafePath.GetDirectory(System.String[])
member.summary: Safely combines multiple directory paths for all platforms. The first path can be a relative or absolute path.
member.param: Ordered list of directory paths.
member.returns: A instance representing the combined directory path of all .

member.name: M:Rampastring.Tools.SafePath.GetFile(System.String[])
member.summary: Safely combines multiple directory paths with a file name for all platforms. The first path can be a relative or absolute path.
member.param: Ordered list of directory paths with a file name.
member.returns: A instance representing the combined directory path and file name of all .

member.name: M:Rampastring.Tools.SafePath.DeleteFileIfExists(System.String[])
member.summary: Safely delete a file represented by multiple directory paths with a file name for all platforms. Does not throw an exception if the file or directory path does not exist.
member.param: Ordered list of directory paths with a file name.

member.name: M:Rampastring.Tools.SafePath.DeleteDirectoryIfExists(System.Boolean,System.String[])
member.summary: Safely delete a directory represented by multiple directory paths for all platforms. Does not throw an exception if the directory path does not exist.

member.name: M:Rampastring.Tools.SafePath.GetFileDirectoryName(System.String[])
member.summary: Safely retrieves the name of a directory represented by multiple directory paths and a file name for all platforms.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.UI.WindowsAndMessaging.FLASHWINFO
member.summary: Contains the flash status for a window and the number of times the system should flash the window.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.UI.WindowsAndMessaging.FLASHWINFO.cbSize
member.summary: The size of the structure, in bytes.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.UI.WindowsAndMessaging.FLASHWINFO.hwnd
member.summary: A handle to the window to be flashed. The window can be either opened or minimized.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.UI.WindowsAndMessaging.FLASHWINFO.uCount
member.summary: The number of times to flash the window.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.UI.WindowsAndMessaging.FLASHWINFO.dwTimeout
member.summary: The rate at which the window is to be flashed, in milliseconds. If dwTimeout is zero, the function uses the default cursor blink rate.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.PInvoke.CloseHandle(Windows.Win32.Foundation.HANDLE)
member.summary: Closes an open object handle.
member.param: A valid handle to an open object.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError. If the application is running under a debugger, the function will throw an exception if it receives either a handle value that is not valid or a pseudo-handle value. This can happen if you close a handle twice, or if you call CloseHandle on a handle returned by the FindFirstFile function instead of calling the FindClose function.

remarks.para: The CloseHandle function closes handles to the following objects:

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.PInvoke.FlashWindowEx(Windows.Win32.UI.WindowsAndMessaging.FLASHWINFO*)
member.summary: Flashes the specified window. It does not change the active state of the window.

param.name: pfwi
param.para: A pointer to a FLASHWINFO structure.

returns.para: The return value specifies the window's state before the call to the FlashWindowEx function. If the window caption was drawn as active before the call, the return value is nonzero. Otherwise, the return value is zero.

member.remarks: Typically, you flash a window to inform the user that the window requires attention but does not currently have the keyboard focus. When a window flashes, it appears to change from inactive to active status. An inactive caption bar changes to an active caption bar; an active caption bar changes to an inactive caption bar.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.OverloadResolutionPriorityAttribute
member.summary: Specifies the priority of a member in overload resolution. When unspecified, the default priority is 0.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.OverloadResolutionPriorityAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The priority of the attributed member. Higher numbers are prioritized, lower numbers are deprioritized. 0 is the default if no attribute is present.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.OverloadResolutionPriorityAttribute.Priority
member.summary: The priority of the member.
